links.body: The Siege of the North, Part 2

paragraphs.body: The curly-tailed blue nose is a ${link_0} resembling a primate that resides in the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: The curly-tailed blue nose is a creature resembling a primate that resides in the Spirit World.

paragraphs.body: Prior to ${link_0}'s arrival in the Spirit World in search of ${link_1}, a curly-tailed blue nose lost its face to the face stealer. Upon arriving, Aang heard this creature as it sat outside ${link_2} and was shocked to see that it was missing its face. After entering Koh's lair, Aang soon found out that Koh had stolen the creature's face and added it to his collection.
paragraphs.text: Prior to Aang's arrival in the Spirit World in search of Koh, a curly-tailed blue nose lost its face to the face stealer. Upon arriving, Aang heard this creature as it sat outside Koh's lair and was shocked to see that it was missing its face. After entering Koh's lair, Aang soon found out that Koh had stolen the creature's face and added it to his collection.

paragraphs.body: After he was knocked unconscious during his ${link_0} with ${link_1} and ${link_2} in the ${link_3}, Aang saw a few more curly-tailed blue noses throughout his journey in the Spirit World.
paragraphs.text: After he was knocked unconscious during his duel with Azula and Zuko in the Crystal Catacombs, Aang saw a few more curly-tailed blue noses throughout his journey in the Spirit World.

paragraphs.body: The curly-tailed blue nose has long, sharp fangs, and yellow, beady eyes. It has an elongated muzzle with distinctive characteristics such as a red stripe down the middle and protruding blue ridges on the sides. Although the rest of the body is coated with brown fur, its face is covered with white fur. Its exceptionally long tail is always curled, hence its name.
paragraphs.text: The curly-tailed blue nose has long, sharp fangs, and yellow, beady eyes. Although the rest of the body is coated with brown fur, its face is covered with white fur. Its exceptionally long tail is always curled, hence its name.
